intro: Senecio ayopayensis, commonly known as the Ayopayensis groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions such as drought resistance. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Senecio ayopayensis is considered a rare and endemic species.
